danfulea.utils

Class FileOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.utils.FileOperation

  • public class FileOperation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used for handling copy operations! It is thread-safe because the only static member that matters, i.e. the buffer, runs in synchronized block! So, this methods can run in multiple threads without causing a mess. It is based on some tutorials/examples freely available on the web.
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 15 APR 2011

    • Method Detail

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(java.lang.String from,
                            java.lang.String to)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        The best way to copy files. Any NIO method (e.g. file channels) corrupts data. Tested!
        Success copy for 3.5 Gb file, 400Mb file!! The copied files were opened using specific
        softwares and we found data are NOT corrupted!!!!
        Parameters:
        from - a string representing the source filename
        to - a string representing the destination filename
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception

      • copyWholeDir

        public static void copyWholeDir(java.lang.String source_name,
                                java.lang.String dest_name)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Copy the whole folder into a parent folder creating a new folder having the same name as the source folder.
        Parameters:
        source_name - the source folder
        dest_name - the destination folder (parent)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - can throw this exception
